user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_ShellOutputToFile:
```c
int32 OS_ShellOutputToFile(const char *Cmd, osal_id_t filedes)
{
    OS_object_token_t token;
    int32             return_code;

    /* Check Parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(Cmd);

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_REFCOUNT, OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_STREAM, filedes, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return_code = OS_ShellOutputToFile_Impl(&token, Cmd);
        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_ShellOutputToFile:
#define OS_CHECK_POINTER(ptr) BUGCHECK((ptr)!=NULL,OS_INVALID_POINTER)
...
int32 OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_lock_mode_t lock_mode, osal_objtype_t idtype, osal_id_t id, OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    int32 return_code;

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdTransactionInit(lock_mode, idtype, token);
    if (return_code != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return return_code;
    }

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex(idtype, id, &token->obj_idx);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        token->obj_id = id;

        /*
         * The "ConvertToken" routine will return with the global lock
         * in a state appropriate for returning to the caller, as indicated
         * by the "check_mode" parameter.
         *
         * Note If this operation fails, then it always unlocks the global for
         * all check_mode's other than NONE.
         */
        return_code = OS_ObjectIdConvertToken(token);
    }

    if (return_code != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        OS_ObjectIdTransactionCancel(token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
...
void OS_ObjectIdRelease(OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    OS_ObjectIdTransactionFinish(token, NULL);
}
...
int32 OS_ShellOutputToFile_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, const char *Cmd)
{
    return OS_ERR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED;
}
...
typedef int32_t   int32
...
typedef uint32 osal_id_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_STREAM 0x06
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I examined the provided function and related symbol definitions for any compiler-specific language extensions (examples: GCC/Clang __attribute__ / __builtin_* / typeof, MSVC __declspec, inline asm (__asm__), statement-expressions ({ ... }), nested functions, nonstandard storage-class specifiers, or other compiler-specific keywords/constructs). None of the provided code fragments use any of those extensions:

- OS_ShellOutputToFile, OS_ObjectIdGetById, OS_ObjectIdRelease, and OS_ShellOutputToFile_Impl use only standard C function definitions and calls.
- The typedefs (int32 -> int32_t, osal_id_t -> uint32) are standard typedefs of fixed-width integer types.
- The macros shown (OS_CHECK_POINTER and the numeric define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_STREAM) are ordinary macros and a hex literal — no extension syntax is present in their visible definitions.

Caveat: The BUGCHECK macro (used inside OS_CHECK_POINTER) and other omitted routines/macros (indicated by ellipses) could potentially use compiler-specific extensions in their hidden definitions. Those definitions are not provided here, so there is no basis in the supplied code to flag them as language extensions. If you want definitive coverage, provide the definitions of BUGCHECK and any other omitted macros/implementations so they can be inspected for compiler-specific extension usage.
